intro: Microterangis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved microterangis, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or well-drained soils, often in heathland or shrubland habitats. Microterangis species are generally low-growing, with some varieties reaching only a few centimeters in height. Due to their limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, many species within this genus are considered threatened or endangered.
